FuncDef:
The nat user-session create-rate extended-range command configures a user session establishment rate.
The undo nat user-session create-rate extended-range command deletes the configured user session establishment rate.
By default, the user session establishment rate is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the user session establishment rate.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535, in sessions per second.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a user session establishment rate, run the nat user-session create-rate extended-range command. If the rate of sending user session establishment packets exceeds the preset threshold, the excess packets are discarded.
Prerequisites
The session rate limit function has been enabled in the associated NAT instance. By default, this function is enabled.
Precautions
The user session establishment rate configured using the nat user-session create-rate extended-range command is expressed in sessions per second and at a smaller precision, whereas the user session establishment rate configured using the nat user-session create-rate command is expressed in Kpps. If both of the two commands are run, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
